milestones.title: Stabilize the storage surface and make it pluggable
milestones.problem_coordinated: The repository currently relies on a minimal, in-memory storage implementation that is fragile and blocks work requiring persistence, concurrency-safety, or swapping implementations (e.g., file or DB backends). This milestone coordinates the design, refactor, and test strategy so downstream features can rely on a stable storage API.
recommended_work_items: Add an interface/README comment describing public storage API (load_all(), save())
Refactor `taskflow/storage.py` to expose a clear backend interface (e.g. in-memory adapter + hooks for other adapters)
Add tests covering concurrent access and clear teardown between tests
Add a small file-backed adapter used only for integration tests (keeps prod surface unchanged)
acceptance_criteria: Storage exposes a documented public API with at least one adapter implementation
New tests demonstrate isolation and concurrency-safety for the in-memory adapter
Existing `tests/test_storage.py` passes and is expanded with adapter-focused tests
Maintainer-approved API docstring or short design note added to repo

milestones.title: Turn the CLI into a small, testable contributor surface
milestones.problem_coordinated: The CLI is currently a placeholder and offers no stable way for contributors or integrators to exercise the library; this milestone coordinates building a minimal, testable command surface and developer docs so contributors can run and validate behavior easily.
recommended_work_items: Add subcommands: `run` (accepts a python module/function path) and `list-storage` (dev-only) with clear help text
Write unit tests for the CLI logic (no heavy integration required) and a smoke integration test that runs `main()`
Add simple input validation and exit codes to make CLI scriptable
acceptance_criteria: CLI has at least one functional subcommand with unit tests
`python -m taskflow.cli` returns helpful usage and exit codes
README contains a short 'getting-started' CLI example

milestones.title: Prototype and validate parallel execution (experimental)
milestones.problem_coordinated: Parallel execution is listed in TODO but currently absent; this milestone coordinates exploratory prototypes, test cases, and API constraints so the community can evaluate approaches without committing to a stable API.
recommended_work_items: Add focused, well-documented prototypes in `taskflow/experimental/` (scheduler + DAG behavior) with no public API commitment
Provide unit tests that demonstrate correctness on small graphs (non-flaky, deterministic tests)
Create an ADR or short design note that lists trade-offs (threading vs processes vs async)
acceptance_criteria: A reproducible prototype lives under `taskflow/experimental/` with tests
Design note exists and clearly states that API is experimental
No changes to the public, stable API in `taskflow/core.py` without maintainer sign-off

milestones.title: Document and stabilize experimental APIs (DAG & scheduler) for contributor use
milestones.problem_coordinated: Experimental modules are present but undocumented and lack tests; contributors need coordination on what is experimental vs stable so work doesn't fragment or duplicate effort.
recommended_work_items: Add README section ‘Experimental API’ describing goals and guarantees
Add usage examples and minimal unit tests for `DAG` and `schedule()` prototypes
Mark APIs with clear docstrings and a migration/stability policy in `README.md`
acceptance_criteria: Experimental modules have documentation and at least one deterministic unit test each
README clearly states experimental status and how contributors should proceed
No breaking changes to stable modules are introduced by these docs

milestones.title: Improve error handling and expand test coverage
milestones.problem_coordinated: Error handling is minimal and test coverage is narrow — this milestone coordinates adding consistent error semantics, input validation, and a broader test-suite so contributors can make safe changes with confidence.
recommended_work_items: Audit existing functions for exception types and add docstrings describing raised errors
Add negative and edge-case tests (empty tasks list, task raising an exception, storage teardown)
Introduce a small, documented error helper module or exception hierarchy if needed
acceptance_criteria: New tests increase coverage for core error paths and are deterministic
Public functions document their error behavior

must_be_sequential_or_blocked.production_parallel_execution: M3 (production-grade) should wait for M1 (storage refactor) and M4 (DAG API stabilization)
